article.title: Complete Genome Sequence of Carnobacterium gilichinskyi Strain WN1359T (DSM 27470T)
funding: NASA Astrobiology: Exobiology and Evolutionary Biology program (NNX08AO15G)
article.abstract: We report the complete genome sequence of Carnobacterium gilichinskyi strain WN1359, previously isolated from Siberian permafrost and capable of growth under cold (0°C), anoxic, CO2-dominated, low-pressure (0.7-kPa) conditions in a simulation of the Mars atmosphere.

sections.introduction: Recently it was reported that Carnobacterium sp. strain WN1359, isolated from Siberian permafrost, was capable of growth under a combination of low-temperature (0°C), low-pressure (0.7-kPa), and CO2-enriched anoxic conditions intended to simulate the atmosphere of Mars (1).
sections.methods: Its genome was sequenced at the University of Florida Interdisciplinary Center for Biotechnology Research (UF-ICBR) using the PacBio SMRT system (Pacific Biosciences, Menlo Park, CA).
sections.results: A total of 78,692 reads were obtained, with a mean read length of 3,850 bp.

article.insights_summary: The complete genome sequence of Carnobacterium gilichinskyi strain WN1359T was reported, providing insights into its molecular basis of response to simulated Martian conditions.
article.acknowledgments: This work was supported by a grant from the NASA Astrobiology: Exobiology and Evolutionary Biology program (NNX08AO15G) to W.L.N. and by award number S10RR027416 from the National Center for Research Resources to W.G.F.

references.text: Leonard MT, Panayotova N, Farmerie WG, Triplett EW, Nicholson WL. 2013. Complete genome sequence of Carnobacterium gilichinskyi strain WN1359T (DSM 27470T). Genome Announc. 1(6):e00985-13. doi:10.1128/genomeA.00985-13.
